content.description: In between the mono problem and the slab face is a large slope rail 5–6 feet off the ground. Start there, make a couple moves on crystals, and top out straight up.
content.location: Ice Cube boulder, just left of the mono problem.

content.description: start high on decent crimps, find feet that work for you and blast up to the lip high off the deck.
content.protection: pads and spotters -- watch out for the trees
content.location: on the backside of the Ice Cube Boulder, below the main trail on the way to the upper section

content.description: Start low below the hump with a heel hook. Press off and fire up to a good sloper on the lip of the hump, and squeeze your way up until you've topped out
content.location: On the Ice Cube Boulder, below the main trail leading to the upper section

content.description: Very technical climb. Good friction conditions are helpful for a send. Start squeezing the arete with left hand on small, smooth crimp, and right hand on a bumpy sloper, climb straight up (somehow...)Sit start goes at V8
content.location: on the Ice Cube Boulder, below the main trail to the upper section

content.description: Start with a left hand pinch next to the obvious jug rail start of the Hump and right hand on the crimp rail right of the jug. Get a high left foot, flag out hard right, gain the arête and finish on the Hump.
content.location: Directly right of the Hump on the Ice Cube boulder, below the main trail leading to the upper section.

content.description: Cross move is hard. Also, the last move will make you want to come down.
content.protection: Pads will be needed. Quite easy landing.
content.location: The back side of ice cube boulder. The other side of this slab is commonly used to down climb. A small tree is on the right side of the climb.

content.description: Start with a left hand razor crimp and a decent right hand sidepull. Pull off the ground and get your left hand on the obvious crystal crimp about 8 feet up. From here, bump your right hand up and get a high right foot to stand up to the lip. (or dyno w/o the high foot)
content.protection: 2-3 pads. There is an inconvenient tree directly in front of the climb. Spotter recommended.
content.location: To the right of Ice Cube Dyno and to the left of The Hump.

content.description: The large, ice cube looking bloc!
